array.string: First man object in space
First man-made object to reach space: the A4-rocket from Germany
First orbital launch: Sputnik 1
The first orbital launch was of the Soviet unmanned Sputnik 1 mission
First dog in space
USSR launches Sputnik 2 carrying the dog Laika: the first animal in orbit
Yuri Gagarin becomes the first man to fly in space.

On April 12, 1961, aboard the spacecraft Vostok 1, Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Alekseyevich Gagarin becomes the first human being to travel into space. During the flight, the 27-year-old test pilot and industrial technician also became the first man to orbit the planet
Alan Shepard is the first American into space, a flight of 15 minutes.
Alan Shepard became the first American in space when the Freedom 7 spacecraft blasted off from Cape Canaveral, Florida, on May 5, 1961, aboard a Mercury-Redstone rocket.
First orbital flight for the USA when John Glenn orbited Earth.
He was one of the Mercury Seven, military test pilots selected in 1959 by NASA as the nation's first astronauts and bacame the first American to orbit the Earth
NASA's Mariner 2 becomes the first spacecraft to fly by Venus.
Mariner 2 was the first spacecraft to successfully fly by Venus, at an altitude of 34,773 kilometers.
Soviet Union: Valentina Tereshkova becomes the first woman in space.
The first woman in space was a Soviet cosmonaut. Valentina Tereshkova launched with the Vostok 6 mission
Aleksei Leonov, becomes the first person to walk in space.
Tethered to his spaceship by a 4.8m (16ft) cable, the Russian floated above the Earth for 12 minutes.
